input: Bob is green. Charlie is blue. Charlie is red. Charlie is smart. Erin is blue. Erin is red. Gary is blue. If Charlie is round then Charlie is red. Blue people are red. All white people are blue. If Erin is white then Erin is round. If someone is red then they are cold. All white, red people are round. If someone is round then they are green. All green people are white. Cold people are white. Question: Gary is not green.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Green Bob
axiom T2 : Blue Charlie
axiom T3 : Red Charlie
axiom T4 : Smart Charlie
axiom T5 : Blue Erin
axiom T6 : Red Erin
axiom T7 : Blue Gary

axiom R1 : Round Charlie → Red Charlie
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Red x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Blue x
axiom R4 : Erin = White → Round Erin
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Cold x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Red x → Round x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Round x → Green x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → White x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x → White x

theorem gary_is_not_green : ¬ Green Gary :=
begin
  intro H,
  have H1 : White Gary := R8 Gary H,
  have H2 : Blue Gary := R3 Gary H1,
  have H3 : Red Gary := R2 Gary H2,
  have H4 : Round Gary := R6 Gary ⟨H1, H3⟩,
  have H5 : Green Gary := R7 Gary H4,
  exact H5,
end

-- The answer is True
